::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module3_mcq_q27')" data-correct-answer="E">
<strong style="display: block;">
A portfolio is 120% long the market index and −20% in the risk-free asset (borrowing at rf). 
If E(Rm)=11% and rf=3%, what is the portfolio’s expected return?
</strong>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q27" value="A"> A. 11.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q27" value="B"> B. 12.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q27" value="C"> C. 12.4%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q27" value="D"> D. 13.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q27" value="E"> E. 12.6%</label><br>
</form>
<div id="feedback-module3_mcq_q27" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: E. Along the CML, E(R)=rf+x(E(Rm)−rf)=3%+1.2×8%=12.6%.
</div>
:::
